newsitem.title: USA: Farallon, Microsoft in online pact.
newsitem.headline: Farallon, Microsoft in online pact.

text.p: Farallon Communications Inc and Microsoft Corp said Monday they've entered a strategic relationship to deliver interoperable Internet/Intranet communication and collaboration products for personal computer users.
As part of the pact, Microsoft paid an undisclosed sum to license Farallon's patent covering cross-platform screen-sharing technology, the companies said.
Farallon's system covers all major desktop operating systems, including Microsoft, Windows 3.1, Windows for Workgroups 3.11, Windows 95, Windows NT and MacOS.

The companies said later this year they plan to announce a separate agreement to develop cross-platform interoperable Internet collaboration products. The products would integrate screen-sharing technology covered by Farallon's patent and provide common capabilities across all versions of Windows-based and MacOS platforms, the companies said.
